content:
• Monday, June 1, 2015
  • NTDOY

    Rumor of Nintendo going Android-based: Not the worst idea?

    • It's a thin rumor, fed by the secrecy around Nintendo's (OTCPK:NTDOY +1.9%) upcoming "NX" console/platform, but a column in Nikkei Shimbun suggests the company could base the system on Google's Android OS.
    • That would be a stark change for a company with tight control over software and OS development, but it's building up some media support today: Users are familiar with a slow Wii U interface that could benefit from a speed injection, and there's a case to be made for stronger third-party development support.
    • Nintendo would likely pursue an Android fork where it wouldn't have to share a cut of game sales with Google (which would surely be a dealbreaker), and -- again due to its tight grip -- would be able to strictly manage a consistent look and feel.
    • As for whether ceding OS development is too much of a culture shock for the company, it did break another barrier this spring by paving the way for its games to go mobile (and thus to other hardware).
    • Previously: Nintendo's mobile plan: Five games by March 2017 (May. 08 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • TUBE

    TubeMogul down 8.9% in late trade on share offering

    • TubeMogul (NASDAQ:TUBE) is off 8.9% after hours as it's filed an S-1 relating to a proposed public share offering.
    • The company says a portion of the shares to be sold would be by TubeMogul and a portion by existing stockholders (for which TubeMogul wouldn't receive any proceeds).
    • J.P. Morgan, BofA Merrill Lynch and Citigroup are acting as joint book runners.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM
  • MTW

    Manitowoc rises as Glenview Capital discloses 7.06% active stake

    • Manitowoc (NYSE:MTW) +2.7% AH after hedge fund Glenview Capital discloses a 7.06% active stake totaling more than 9.6M shares in the company, up from the more than 8.6M shares held as of March 31.
    • Larry Robbins' fund says it may discuss with MTW options for exploring alternatives that could enhance shareholder value.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: AVEO +3.1%. MDVN +3.1%. XOOM +2.3%. OCLR +1.9%. CDXS +1.7%.
    • Top losers: TUBE -8.9%. QUNR -3.6%. FLML -3.4%. UEPS -3.2%. CERU -2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM | 3 Comments
  • FGP

    Ferrellgas Partners to launch 6.325M-unit offering

    • Ferrellgas Partners (NYSE:FGP) -3.2% AH after announcing a public offering of 6.235M common units, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 948,750 units.
    • FGP says it plans to use the proceeds to fund part of its pending acquisition of Bridger Logistics.
    • FGP also says its operating subsidiary will offer $400M in aggregate principal amount of senior unsecured notes due 2023 in a private placement.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • BXMT

    Blackstone Mortgage Trust -2.1% after another capital raise

    • Blackstone Mortgage Trust (NYSE:BXMT) announces a 10M share secondary offering with underwriter greenshoe of another 1.5M shares.
    • The company six weeks ago sold 20M shares to help raise funds for its purchase of a commercial loan portfolio from GE Capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • DMDA

    Dex Media up 34% for second day of gains

    • More gains on high volume for Dex Media (DXM), up 34.5% today, building on Friday's 15.4% gain. There no notable news on the stock.
    • To put the gains in perspective, it's coming off a 52-week low or $0.67 on Friday morning and has still lost 87.2% of value YTD. Shares traded at $8.81 on Jan. 2.
    • After crumbling on a rough Q1 report last month, emphasis was on fixing the sales side of the operation, as its sales chief had resigned and revenues dropped 11%.
    • Short percentage of float at April's end was 42%, with prior-month shares up to 5.29M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 12 Comments
  • PVH

    New buyback and positive underlying comps lift PVH Corp.

    • PVH Corp. (NYSE:PVH) reports revenue was up 5% for the Calvin Klein business and 1% for Tommy Hilfiger in Q1 on a constant currency basis.
    • The North America retail store comp was -1% for Calvin Klein  and -3% for Tommy Hilfiger as a strong U.S. dollar held back international tourist spending.
    • The company says it authorized a new $500M buyback program.
    • Guidance: PVH expects full-years EPS of $6.85-$6.95 vs. $6.86 consensus.
    • Previously: Phillips-Van Heusen beats by $0.12, beats on revenue (June 1)
    • PVH +2.41% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • PVH

    Phillips-Van Heusen beats by $0.12, beats on revenue

    • Phillips-Van Heusen (NYSE:PVH): Q1 EPS of $1.50 beats by $0.12.
    • Revenue of $1.88B (-4.1% Y/Y) beats by $20M.
    • Shares +2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • LUV

    Southwest CEO pulls up airline sector with comments

    • Southwest Airlines (LUV +2.3%) CEO Gary Kelly brought some cheer to the airline sector when he told Bloomberg TV it will increase capacity this year at a 7% rate - instead of the 8% pace tipped off last month.
    • "We’re going to make sure we manage accordingly to the low end of the range. That should address some of the concerns of our investors,” said Kelly.
    • Alaska Air Group (ALK +2.2%), American Airlines Group (AAL +4.3%), Delta Air Lines (DAL +3.4%), and United Continental (UAL +3.2%) all reacted positively to the cautious stance from Southwest.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 23 Comments
  • ATNM

    Investors underwhelmed with 25% response rate for Actinium Pharma's Actimab-A

    • Actinium Pharmaceuticals (ATNM -19%) slumps on a 4x surge in volume in response to its abstract (#7050) and poster on Actimab-A that was presented yesterday at ASCO.
    • In a Phase 1/2 study in elderly patients with newly diagnosed acute myeloid leukemia, subjects treated with Actimab-A showed an overall response rate of only 25% (n=3/12), but 67% (n=2/3) in those treated with the highest dose (1.5 uCi/kg/fraction).
    • A fourth cohort at a dose 33% higher (2.0) began recently.
    • Actimab-A is a monoclonal antibody with an attached radioisotope (Actinium 225) that binds to cancer cells thereby delivering radiotherapy directly to the cancer.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 19 Comments
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy, Cloud Peak sink on negative Goldman Sachs view

    • Peabody Energy (BTU -9%) and Cloud Peak Energy (CLD -9.3%) are sharply lower after Goldman Sachs recommends investors sell shares, seeing BTU as something of a proxy for its bearish view on met coal prices - which the firm expects to remain pressured through 2017 - and CLD as a pure-play exposure to Powder River Basin thermal coal.
    • However, the firm sees "idiosyncratic opportunities" for substantial gains in the coal sector, identifying Illinois Basin thermal coal as the one thermal coal segment where fundamentals are not negative and naming Foresight Energy (FELP +3.5%) a Buy for its pure-play exposure to the IB and attractive drop-down potential following the recent Murray Energy transaction.
    • Goldman also maintains its Buy rating on SunCoke Energy (SXC -1.2%) given low-cost, organic growth from dropdowns, a strong balance sheet that improves prospects of inorganic growth and attractive valuation.
    • The firm also maintains its Neutral rating on Arch Coal (ACI +2.8%) while upgrading Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +2.6%) to Neutral from Sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 28 Comments
  • GSAT

    Globalstar slides 12.6% as Microsoft urges rejection of technology

    • Globalstar (NYSEMKT:GSAT) is off 12.6% today -- giving back strong Friday gains and then some -- as Microsoft is urging the FCC to reject Globalstar's key Terrestrial Low Power Service (TLPS) technology.
    • In an ex parte filing made public today, Microsoft pointed to its agreement with the Consumer Electronics Association, which urged deferring approval until "comprehensive, open and transparent" testing of TLPS to ensure it didn't interfere with Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and other adjacent spectrum.
    • "Disappointingly, the record has shown that Globalstar has chosen not to take such actions," Microsoft says.
    • Microsoft expressed concern about interference with game consoles like the Xbox (which rely extensively on the 2.4 GHz band), and that Globalstar could switch to LTE from an 802.11 standard, which could risk substantially more interference than demonstrated.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 9 Comments
  • CZR

    Caesars Entertainment -14% as investors digest court developments

    • Caesars Entertainment (CZR -13.7%) is down sharply after a court ruling from late last week is viewed by investors as going in favor of bondholders.
    • The development could force Caesars to negotiate better terms for senior and junior bond holders.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • SPCB

    SuperCom +11.2% after Q1 report; guidance reiterated

    • SuperCom (NASDAQ:SPCB) has blasted off after posting nearly in-line Q1 results and reiterating its 2015 guidance (40%+ revenue growth, EPS above $1.20). Shares currently trade at 10x a 2015 EPS consensus of $1.21.
    • Positive CC remarks about deal activity are likely providing a lift; management stated it has been selected as a bidder of choice for contracts from multiple governments. An April report from Security Document World fueled hopes SuperCom will win a deal to manage registration for Kenya's National Digital Registry Service.
    • CEO Arie Trablesi in the earnings release: "During [Q1], we have started to integrate our suite of secure payments solutions into existing e-ID contracts and continue to actively pursue large opportunities with organizations around the world ... We are increasingly excited about our pipeline of opportunities, which continued to grow as we advanced a number of important tenders during the quarter."
    • Financials: Q1 gross margin was 70.1%, up slightly from Q4's 69.4% and down from Q1 2014's 80.7%. GAAP operating expenses fell 4% Y/Y to $2.79M - sales/marketing spend totaled $1.4M, R&D $67&K, and G&A $716K. SuperCom ended Q1 with $4.2M in cash, $4.5M in restricted bank deposits, and no debt.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • AMBA

    Ambarella +5% after GoPro camera launch; earnings due tomorrow

    • Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) has surged to new highs yet again after GoPro (up 6.7%) unveiled the HERO+, a $300 camera (presumably powered by an Ambarella video processor) sporting a touchscreen LCD, Wi-Fi/Bluetooth connectivity, and 60fps 1080p video recording. The camera is priced below the $400 HERO4 Silver and $500 HERO4 Black, and above the $130 entry-level HERO.
    • Shares are now up 66% YTD, and trade for 33x an FY17 (ends Jan. '17) EPS consensus of $2.86 (estimates have been gradually rising). FQ1 results arrive tomorrow afternoon.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn up 3.5% amid activist rumor, bullish RBC note

    • An unconfirmed rumor (picked up by Briefing.com) that activist investors are taking stakes in LinkedIn (LNKD) appears to be lifting shares.
    • Also possibly helping: A bullish note from RBC's Mark Mahaney (Outperform, $275 target) that follows meetings with sales, content, and IR execs. Among other things, Mahaney reports LinkedIn: 1) Is "very confident that engagement is rising." 2) Sees an $8B-$15B/year market opportunity for its Sales Solutions (social selling) product. 3) Is upbeat about its ability to cross-sell Lynda.com's online learning offerings to 37K HR units within organizations. 4) Is (notably) "seeing a rebound in productivity trends" following a Q1 Talent Solutions salesforce reorg.
    • LinkedIn is a month removed from plunging due to the Q2/2015 guidance provided with its Q1 beat. The outlook was blamed on the reorg, a strong dollar, soft ad sales, and the impact of piloting different approaches to cross-selling Lynda.com services. Many analysts defended the company afterwards.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • GNOW

    American Caresource up 73% on heavy volume

    • Thinly traded nano cap American Caresource Holdings (ANCI +72.9%) skyrockets on a whopping 24x surge in volume. No particular news accounts for the action. Long-term stockholders are no doubt happy with the move regardless of the reason. Shares are still down over 90% from the November 2008 peak of $28.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • SMCI

    Super Micro +6.1%; fund manager plugs shares on CNBC

    • On CNBC this morning (video), Delphi Management's Scott Black named Super Micro (NASDAQ:SMCI) one of his top three picks. He predicts the modular server OEM will continue posting ~20% sales growth, and estimates shares are trading at 13x forward EPS after backing out stock compensation spend.
    • Black: "There are just not many 20% growers selling at 13 P/E." Super Micro's FQ4 (June quarter) consensus implies 26.1% Y/Y sales growth, while its FY16 (ends June '16) consensus implies 14.7% growth.
    • Shares have rallied to their highest levels since mid-April, when they sold off in response to a Q1 miss.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • QUNR

    Qunar up 4.2% ahead of earnings

    • Qunar (NASDAQ:QUNR) is posting big gains ahead of this afternoon's Q1 report. 1.42M shares have been traded thus far, topping a 3-month daily average of 1.26M.
    • The fast-growing Chinese online travel firm is up 59% since providing a big Q1 beat and strong Q2 guidance on March 16.  Shares recently pared their gains after archrival Ctrip announced an investment in eLong and received fresh funding from Priceline.
    • Also: SA author John Zhang recently wrote a pair of bearish columns (I, II), arguing (among other things) Qunar parent Baidu is prioritizing its own interests over those of Qunar shareholders. Jeff Cai offered a more bullish take.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ANCI +39%. ESI-OLD +31%. SPCB +16%. CCCR-OLD +14%. TAOM +14%. OGXI +13%. BOOT +13%. CIA +12%. CCCL +11%. PRAN +10%.
    • Losers: TBIO -16%. HQCL -15%. PBMD -14%. CZR -14%. UWN -13%. DATE -13%. GSAT -11%. KIQ -10%. WG -9%. VCO-OLD -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 10 Comments
  • HK

    Halcon Resources up on insider buying disclosure

    • Halcon Resources (HK +2.8%) is higher following the disclosure that Chairman/CEO Floyd Wilson purchased 1M shares of he company's stock on the open market in transactions last Thursday and Friday.
    • The stock was purchased at an average cost of $1.03/share, with a total value of $1,03M; following the transaction, Wilson now directly owns nearly 4.75M HK shares valued at ~$4.9M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 7 Comments
  • REGI

    Renewable Energy upgraded by Piper Jaffray after new EPA proposal

    • Renewable Energy (REGI +10.4%) is upgraded to Overweight from Neutral with a $15 price target, raised from $11, at Piper Jaffray following last week's release of the EPA proposal of the renewable fuel standard mandate which the firm says removes the regulatory overhang that has historically impacted REGI shares.
    • Jaffray expects the increase proposed in the advanced biofuel category, along with the 20% carryover, to drive biodiesel demand "beyond the biomass-based diesel RVO," which in turn should lead to higher margins for REGI, despite a potential increase in biodiesel imports.
    • The firm also expects margins to be driven by higher RINs following the EPS proposal.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • ASUUY

    Pixelworks up 13.5% on Asus video processor deal

    • Asus (OTC:ASUUY) is using Pixelworks' (NASDAQ:PXLW) Iris mobile video processor in its new Hero ZenPad tablet. The companies appear to be referring to Asus' ZenPad S 8.0, an 8" Android tablet that was unveiled this morning at the Computex trade show; it has a 2048x1536 resolution and quad-core Intel Atom CPU.
    • Asus/Pixelworks also state the ZenPad is "the world's first tablet to incorporate Pixelworks' True Clarity display enhancements," and claim True Clarity integration allows the device to provide blur-free video, cleaner/sharper images, and automatic lighting compensation.
    • Pixelworks has surged to its highest levels since early March. The company stated during its April 30 Q1 CC it had landed new Iris design wins; a second-gen version of the processor is expected to enter mass-production by year's end.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • TRP

    TransCanada wins deals with three more First Nations for proposed pipeline

    • TransCanada (TRP -1.8%) says it has reached project agreements with three more First Nations in British Columbia as part of efforts to build the Prince Rupert Gas Transmission pipeline across the province to a proposed liquefied natural gas terminal on the coast.
    • TRP does not announce specifics but says they provide for annual legacy payments over the commercial life of the pipeline plus benefits upon signing and at other milestones.
    • TRP already had reached four other First Nations agreements but members of the Lax Kw’alaams First Nation rejected a $1.15B offer from Petronas, which wants to build the Pacific Northwest LNG terminal on Lelu Island south of Prince Rupert.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 3 Comments
  • SINA

    Sina +22.5%, Weibo +7.4%; Sina CEO investing $456M

    • SINA chairman/CEO Charles Chao plans to buy 11M newly-issued shares at $41.49 apiece (total cost of $456M). His purchase price is equal to Sina's 30-day average closing price as of May 29, and above a Friday close of $40.73.
    • Chao's shares are subject to a 6-month lockup restriction. Sina had $2.1B in cash/short-term investments at the end of Q1, and $800M in convertible debt.
    • Sina has soared to its highest levels since last summer, and has taken subsidiary Weibo higher with it.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • MRTX

    Mirati Therapeutics drops after patients treated with MGCD265 do not meet RECIST criteria for clinical response

    • Thinly traded Mirati Therapeutics (MRTX -17.2%) slumps on a 7x surge in volume in response to the presentation of an abstract (#2589) at ASCO on a Phase 1 trial of its tyrosine kinase inhibitor, MGCD265, in heavily pretreated patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with MET gene mutations.
    • According to investigators, MGCD265 showed anti-tumor activity and clinical benefit (improvements in pain and shortness of breath) in the first three patients treated, but none met RECIST criteria for responses, which is the metric used in clinical trials.
    • RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors) is a standardized method to measure the change in tumor burden.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming higher after upgrade

    • Credit Suisse walked away from a meeting with Boyd Gaming's (BYD +2.9%) top brass confident the casino operator can show improved results in Las Vegas and Atlantic City.
    • Boyd trades only slight below its 52-week high.
    • CS has Boyd rated at Outperform with a $18 price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • OUT

    Outfront Media launches in-house creative unit

    • Out-of-home advertising firm Outfront Media (NYSE:OUT) is up 2% after the launch of its in-house boutique, Outfront Studios, charged with designing campaigns for its clients internally.
    • One of the unit's first designs was an award-winner for Georgia Tech athletics.
    • The design team will develop display advertising in consultation with clients using Outfront's proprietary research.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond higher on chatter of activist stake

    • Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +1.2%) spikes on strong volume after speculation of an activist stake by Jana Partners starts to make the rounds.
    • Shares of BBBY are back over $72 for the first time in two weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • RXDX

    Ignyta up 34% on encouraging results for entrectinib

    • Thinly traded small cap Ignyta (RXDX +33.7%) jumps on a 10x surge in volume in response to poster presentations (abstracts #2596 and #2517) at ASCO on two Phase 1 studies of entrectinib, the company's proprietary oral tyrosine kinase inhibitor. One of the objectives was to determine the optimal dose of entrectinib for a Phase 2 trial in patients with certain mutation-positive tumors.
    • Encouraging efficacy was also observed, however. In 11 patients who would meet the anticipated eligibility criteria for the planned Phase 2, 10 showed clinical activity demonstrating a preliminary response rate of 91% (n=10/11).
    • Tyrosine kinase is an enzyme that serves as an "on/off" switch in many cellular functions. If stuck in the "on" position, unregulated cell growth occurs.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • TPH

    TRI Pointe Homes +3.75% as it finds a sell-side fan

    • "We think TRI Pointe Homes (TPH +3.7%) is making good progress integrating its WRECO acquisition from 2014, and we expect this will be the primary driver of earnings in an improving housing environment," says FBR's Patrick Kealey, upgrading to Outperform and lifting the price target by $1 to $17. "We believe higher volumes, coupled with its unique land portfolio, should give TPH the ability to grow longterm operating margins faster than competitors."
    • The market, however, is not pricing in this potential as the stock trades at a valuation discount to peers, says Kealey. Continued execution over time should narrow the gap, he says.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • WELL

    Health Care REIT higher after Evercore upgrade

    • Health Care REIT (HCN +1.1%) is an outlier to the upside among the seniors housing and healthcare names after being upgraded to Buy at Evercore ISI.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 3 Comments
  • BKNG

    HomeAway +5.3%; Priceline's Kayak unit to show vacation rentals

    • Priceline's (PCLN -0.2%) Kayak travel search engine will now include nearly 200K HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY) vacation rental listings. The deal is expected to go live by year's end.
    • The companies state travelers will be able to "search and find vacation rentals on KAYAK just as they would a hotel and complete their reservation on the HomeAway site where the property is listed." Kayak currently shows over 700K hotel listings.
    • Priceline hasn't broken out Kayak's sales since acquiring the company in 2013. Priceline did state on its Q4 CC (transcript) Kayak delivered "strong top-line results and bottom-line results significantly [exceeding] our expectations at the time of acquisition" in 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • CTIC

    CTI BioPharma up 18% on positive results for pacritinib in rare blood cancer

    • CTI BioPharma (CTIC +17.5%) jumps in early trading in response to its announcement at ASCO (abstract #LBA7006) that patients with myelofibrosis treated with its lead product candidate, pacritinib, in a Phase 3 trial called PERSIST-1 met the primary efficacy endpoint of a statistically significant reduction in spleen volume compared to baseline at week 24. The results were originally reported in March.
    • Fast Track-designated pacritinib, an oral tyrosine kinase inhibitor, is being co-developed with Baxter International (BAX -0.2%). Tyrosine kinase is an enzyme that serves as an "on/off" switch in many cellular functions. If stuck in the "on" position, unregulated cell growth occurs.
    • Previously: CTI Bio up 19% premarket on Phase 3 results (March 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 8 Comments
  • JNPR

    Juniper -3%; MKM downgrades, cites carrier technology trends

    • Believing the bull case for the company is based on "faulty assumptions" that ignore major changes in carrier router usage, MKM's Michael Genovese has downgraded Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) to Sell, while keeping its target at $22.
    • Specifically, Genovese argues tier-1 carriers appear committed to ""a multi-step network transition that includes fewer Routing nodes (more Optical nodes) and aggressive Router pricing demands near-term," and that they eventually want to "deploy more multi-purpose, standardized hardware and to open-up the network software to be more multi-vendor and programmable" (i.e. adopt SDN and NFV). Juniper client AT&T is among the carriers embracing the latter trend, via its Domain 2.0 initiative.
    • Genovese also believes 2H15 consensus estimates - they assume rebounding telecom capex - are too high, and that Juniper is unlikely to be acquired by a larger vendor. Speculation about an Ericsson bid has been running high since the Nokia/Alcatel-Lucent deal.
    • Shares remain up 21% YTD. They trade for 16x 2015E EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM

  • Treasury prices slide after national PMI heads higher

    • The Manufacturing ISM headline PMI rose to 52.8 in May from April's 51.5. Forecasts called for a gain to 52.0. The solid print is especially notable given the unexpected dive in the Chicago PMI (reported on Friday).
    • New Orders rose to 55.8 from 53.5. Production slipped to 54.5 from 56. Employment 51.7 vs. 48.3. Supplier Deliveries 50.7 vs. 50.1. Backlogs 53.5 vs. 49.5.
    • Prices jumped to 49.5 from 40.5.
    • At 2.12% ahead of the number, the 10-year Treasury yield jumps to 2.16%, up three basis points on the session. TLT -0.8%, TBT +1.6%
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, TLH, SBND, VGLT, UBT, DLBS, TLO, TENZ, LBND, DLBL, TYBS, VUSTX
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMC

    Theater chains receive DOJ request for documents

    • Exhibitor stocks are skittish after the Department of Justice asks several chains for more documents relating to an anti-trust probe of the industry.
    • The larger theater chains have been accused of using clearance agreements to pressure studios away from using small and independent chains.
    • The matter hasn't been escalated to a full DOJ investigation yet.
    • Previously: Movie exclusivity deals with theater chains on the DOJ radar (Apr. 17 2015)
    • Decliners: AMC Entertainment (NYSE:AMC) -4.4%, Carmike Cinemas (NASDAQ:CKEC) -1.0%, Cinemark Holdings (NYSE:CNK) -0.4%, Regal Entertainment (NYSE:RGC) -0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • AMCN

    AirMedia Group rallies after winning Wi-Fi train contract in Beijing

    • AirMedia Group (AMCN +8.2%) jumps after one of the company's Chinese entities landed the Wi-Fi rights for some trains run in Beijing.
    • The contract covers 89 ordinary trains run by the Beijing Railway Bureau.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen gaps up 49% on positive results in difficult-to-treat ovarian cancer

    • ImmunoGen (IMGN +49%) jumps out of the gate this morning in response to its announcement of positive results in a Phase 1 dose ranging trial assessing its antibody-drug conjugate, IMGN853 (mirvetuximab soravtansine), in patients with folate-receptor alpha-positive platinum-resistant ovarian cancer, a difficult-to-treat type with typical response rates of less than 20%.
    • The overall response rate was 53% (n=9/17) which included one complete response and eight partial responses. Responses in six of the nine patients were ongoing at the time of data cutoff, with five of the six on treatment for more than 15 weeks. The data were presented as ASCO (abstract #5558).
    • The company plans to initiate a Phase 2 study later this year that may support a New Drug Application (NDA) filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 3 Comments
  • POST

    Post Holdings +3% after Wells Fargo turns optimistic

    • Wells Fargo upgrades Post Holdings (NYSE:POST) to an Outperform rating from Market Perform.
    • Shares of Post Holdings fell 7.8% in May as concerns on the impact of the avian flu in the Midwest increased.
    • POST +3.42% premarket to $44.74.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 3 Comments
  • EXEL

    Exelixis up 10% premarket on successful lung cancer study

    • Exelixis (NASDAQ:EXEL) is up 10% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial, Study E1512, assessing cabozantinib  (Cometriq) for the treatment of EGFR wild-type non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
    • The study met its primary endpoint of a statistically significant increase in progression-free survival (PFS) in patients treated with cabozantinib and the combination of cabozantinib plus Roche's Tarceva (erlotinib) compared to patients treated with erlotinib alone. PFS for the cabozantinib monotherapy cohort was 4.2 months versus 1.9 months for erlotinib alone (p=0.0004). PFS for the cabozantinib + erlotinib was 4.7 months (p=0.0005).
    • Overall survival, a secondary endpoint, for the three arms was 9.2 months, 13.3 months and 4.1 months, respectively (p=0.004).
    • Most patients had a rough go of it, though. Grade 3 (severe) or higher (life threatening) adverse events were 67% in the cabozantinib mono arm, 72% in the combo arm compared to 35% in the erlotinib arm.
    • Cabozantinib
    • The data will be presented today (abstract #8003) at ASCO.

  • VBLT

    Vascular Biogenics up 11% premarket on positive results for lead product candidate in brain cancer

    • Micro cap Vascular Biogenics (NASDAQ:VBLT) is up 11% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of positive interim results from a Phase 2 study assessing its lead product candidate, VB-111, in patients with recurrent glioblastoma (rGBM), one of the most aggressive primary brain tumors. The data showed a statistically significant benefit in overall survival (OS) in patients treated with VB-111 followed by VB-111 in combination with Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) Avastin (bevacizumab) upon disease progression compared to patients treated with VB-111 followed by bevacizumab alone (p=0.05). The full results were presented earlier this morning at a meeting for investors in conjunction with ASCO.
    • 46 patients with rGBM were treated with VB-111. Upon disease progression, 23 were treated with VB-111 + bevacizumab and 22 received bevacizumab alone (one patient was stable on VB-111 alone after 18 months). Median OS in the combination arm was 16 months compared to eight months in the bevacizumab alone arm (p=0.05).
    • VB-111 is an anti-angiogenic agent which is designed to restrict tumor growth by inhibiting the proliferation of new blood vessels that form to support rapidly growing cells.
    • The company intends to initiate a Phase 3 trial later this year.

  • CASC

    Oncothyreon up 46% premarket on ONT-380 study results

    • Small cap Oncothyreon (ONTY) is up 46% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement at ASCO of positive data from a Phase 1b clinical trial evaluating its lead product candidate, ONT-380, in combination with Roche's Xeloda (capecitabine) and Herceptin (trastuzumab), as third line treatment of patients with HER-positive metastatic breast cancer. The trial was a dose escalation study in patients previously treated with Herceptin and Kadcyla (ado-trastuzumab emtansine).
    • The disease control rate in 27 evaluable patients in all three cohorts combined (ONT-380 + Xeloda; ONT-380 + Herceptin; ONT-380 + Xeloda + Herceptin) was 85% (n=23/27). Specifically, two patients had a complete response, 12 showed a partial response and nine showed stable disease. Four patients progressed.
    • Results from another Phase 1b study assessing ONT-380 in patients with metastatic breast cancer with central nervous system (CNS) metastases showed a 64% disease control rate (n=14/22) (one complete response, four partial responses and nine with stable disease). No patient had progressive disease as a CNS best response.
    • ONT-380 was well tolerated in both studies. Most adverse events were either grade 1 or 2.
    • The company intends to advance ONT-380 to Phase 2 development later this year.
    • Previously: ASCO abstract-stoked investors bid up Oncothyreon (May 14)
